titleStmt.title: he Old Maid and the Thief

body.stage: (Miss Todd’s Parlor, late afternoon)MISS TODDGood day, Miss Pinkerton.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Give me your raincoat, your overshoes.
and tell me the news while I make some tea.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: The water is boiling in the kettle…

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: It seems the postman brought a letter to Miss Paxton;
when she saw the writing down she fell with a cry…

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: You’re not trying to hide it from me!

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: I assure you, nobody knows why.

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: Do you approve of the new minister?

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: He is well bred and well read and handsome.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Indeed I don’t! She’s fat, she’s vulgar.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: I know… That was thirty years ago.

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: I know… That was forty years ago.
My lover sailed to be a sailor of the sea
but said I was the ship
on which to fix his mast.
and full of many a ship;
he sailed for his first trip,
that’s when I saw him last.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: My lover had a plan to be a learned man
but said I was the book in which to found his creed.
Alas, why must man need so long and many a book;
for all this time he took to read and read and read.

sp.speaker: TOGETHER:
sp.l: Life is but a broken promise.
And why should God keep his promise
the first who trod upon his promise.
Since then has truth flown from us.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: And life is but a broken promise.

body.stage: (A knock is heard )

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Somebody knocked at the back door.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: A man? What does he want?

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: He says that he must speak to you in strict privacy.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: The idea! Don’t you see I am having tea
Tell him to come back later.

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: Not on my account! It’s time
for me to go home, anyhow.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: So soon! It was such a short afternoon.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Your raincoat, your overshoes. Do come again.

body.stage: MISS TODD(to herself)I thought she’d never leave.
(to Laetitia)

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Ma’am… he’s not a visitor, he’s only a beggar.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: A beggar! Give him a nickel and send him away.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: But he’s so young and handsome!
Don’t send him away. It would be a sin.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Be a Christian. Ask him in.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Who cares! Just take a look at him!

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Haven’t you a home or a vocation?

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: I have an ideal and we wonder together.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: For I meant to invite you to stay overnight,
for some rest and a meal.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: But I can accept all the same.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Well, Bob, come in the parlor.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Laetitia, run upstairs and fetch that old bathrobe
and slippers of my poor uncle Paul.
I hope you’re not too cold.
Stand by the fire and make yourself at home

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: the water is boiling in the kettle.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: If that is so I’ll have some.

body.stage: (The kitchen of Miss Todd’s house,the next morning)MISS TODDGood day, Laetitia.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Good morning, Madame! Why up so early?

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: All night I felt so excited, I could not sleep a wink.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Quite asleep, I think. He has not made a sound.

sp.speaker: TOGETHER:
sp.l: And clever! And funny! And bright and profound!
I never heard such funny jokes
as he told us after dinner…

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: How shall I stand it today to see him go away?

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: This town will be a tomb.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: And what gloom in this house!

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: How different is a room with a man in it!
Miss Todd, I have a plan to submit.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Why don’t you ask him to stay another week?

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: hey soon will see that we are three.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: don’t you have dozens of uncles and cousins?
Say that he’s one of them.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Once they have seen him, they will suspect.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: and that he will not see anybody.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: A hungry man is easily bent.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: But who shall make him the proposition?

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: If you don’t dare to face the matter
I shall take care of it with a good breakfast

body.stage: (Bob’s bedroom, immediately after)LAETITIAGood morning!Hey, good morning, Bob!

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: I had to shake you, but since it is quite late
I thought I’d better wake you.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: After sleeping on the ground with a stone
for a pillow and leaves for a couch

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: Am I to eat it in bed?

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Of course. But straighten your legs.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: Coffee and toast! Ham and eggs!

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: And she gave me the task to ask
if you would stay with us another week.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: To eat, and drink, and sleep

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: But for the neighbours you’re Cousin Steve,
and we believe it shall be wise
to shun suspicion that you be seen by no one.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: It shall be done, but I warn you both before,
I’ll be a cousin nothing more.
I hate women to the core.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Do you mean you’ll never marry,
and shy and can cook as well as I?

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Coming! What was it we were saying?

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: I’d like to choke her. Coming!

body.stage: (In the street, a few minutes later)MISS PINKERTONMiss Todd!

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: Have you heard?! Have you read?!
A most terrible thief has fled
from the county jail of Timberville.
The town is in great fear
for he was seen not far from here.
He’s the terror of the nation.
and kill at the slightest provocation.
He has committed crime after crime
for as little as a dime.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: A thief! A murderer! And what does he look like?

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: Tall and burly, hair black and curly,

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Tall and burly… hair black and curly…
Oh dear me! I must run home!

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: I want to warn Laetitia right away. Goodbye.

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: Goodbye. But by the way; that old Miss Perkins
who always spies on everyone says
out right that you had a male guest over-night.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: A great surprise; back from Australia
my cousin Steve has just arrived,
He won’t see anyone for he’s in mourning.
I’m helping him all that I can,

body.stage: (Miss Todd’s Parlor, immediately after)MISS TODDLaetitia!

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Miss Todd, why all this clatter?

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Have you heard? Have you read?

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: But what has happened? Are you ill?

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Oh, my dear, let me sit down!

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: In town I met Miss Pinkerton
A thief, a murderer, she said!
He was seen not far from here; and, my dear,
he’s tall and burly, hair black and curly,

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: He might have murdered us last night!

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: I thought he did look strange.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: How can we explain his presence here?
Already I’ve made Miss Pinkerton believe
that he is my cousin Steve.
and rid ourselves of him in a more subtle
way as if we’d no suspicions.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: to stay with us another week.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: we’ll have to keep him here.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Why! Laetitia! You must be out of your mind!
A lady of my kind to entertain a fugitive!
He’ll rob and kill me in my own bed.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Since he did not rob and murder us last night

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Laetitia! You’re talking though your hat.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: For that matter, to be killed by a man would really
be much better than to live without one.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: You might lead him to the right path.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: He’ll kill us like two flies.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Not if we make him feel secure.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: He’ll soon find out I’m poor
and lose all interest in me.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Don’t give yourself away. Act as if you’d money
aplenty, and even let him have some of it; a little
every day, today ten dollars, tomorrow twenty.
That will contrive to keep his interest alive.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: But where to find the money?

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Aren’t you the treasurer of the New Mission Society

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Do you suggest that I should steal?

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Take all the money you need
next month you’ll put it back,
and no one shall ever know of it.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: I don’t see what is wrong with it.

sp.speaker: TOGETHER:
sp.l: Good morning! Did you sleep well?

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: that I have missed a sunrise!

body.stage: (The kitchen, a week later)LAETITIAWhat a curse for a womenis a timid man!A week has gone by;he had plenty of chances,but he made no advances.Miss Todd schemes and laboursto get him some money.She robs friends and neighboursthe club and the church.He takes all the money with a smile that entrances…but still makes no advances.The old woman sighs and makes languid eyes.All the drawers are wide open,all the doors are unlocked…He neither seems pleased nor shocked.He eats and drinks and sleeps,he talks of baseball and boxing…but that is all.What a curse for a woman isa timid man!Steal me.Oh, steal me, sweet thief,for time’s flight is stealing my youthand the cares of life steal fleeting time.Steal me, thief, for life is briefand full of theft and strife.And then, with furtive step, death comesand steals time and life.O sweet thief, I pray make me diebefore dark death steals her prey.Steal my lips before they crumble to dust.Steal my heart before death must.Steal my cheeks before they’re sunkand decayed.Steal my breath before it will fade.Steal my lips, steal my heart,steal my cheeks, steal, oh steal my breathand make me diebefore death will steal her prey.Oh, steal me! For time’s flightis stealing my youth.
(In Miss Todd’s parlor, immediately after)MISS PINKERTONMiss Todd!

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Miss Pinkerton, won’t you sit down?

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: Have you heard? Have you read?
The thief is still hiding in town
and has robbed many houses in the
neighbourhood. He’s daring, quick and shrewd.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: But has someone had any proof?

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: Miss Manning has missed lots of money,
Miss Paxton has not seen her purse
since that morning you came for a visit.

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: on Monday the Sunday collection is missing.

sp.speaker: TOGETHER:
sp.l: We must ask the police for protection.

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: But by the way… How is your cousin?
Is he still so very, very ill?

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: I’m afraid that he never will be very, very well.

body.stage: (Bob’s bedroom, immediately afterBob is packing their things)BOBWhen the air sings of summer,I must wander again.Sweet landlord is the sky,rich house is the plain, and to live is to wanderthrough the sun and the rain.When the air sings of summer,I must wander again.First you wander in youth and joythen you’ll wander to still the fearsin an old heart.First you wander to find your love,then you’ll wander to hide your tears,for a wanderer must depart.When a man owns a househe’s a bird in a cage whose captivitypain is sweetened with age.Ah! The sharp joy of freedomis my loss and my gain.When the air sings of summer,I must wander again.
(Laetitia knocks at the door)

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: I belong to the road; being shut in a house

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Please, dear Bob, don’t go away!

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: This is not what I seek.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: We’re ready to give you whatever you want.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: But what about my point of view?!
Here I have nothing to do from morning ‘till night.
I don’t read, I don’t write, I don’t work,
I don’t think… If at least I could have…

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: My dear! Do you mean liquor?!! Miss Todd.

body.stage: (The Parlor, immediately afterwards)LAETITIAMiss Todd!

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: if we don’t buy him liquor.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: I who direct the Prohibition Committee!
No, I must refuse. Has he no pity?!
Already I’ve stolen for him and now
he demands that I spoil my good standing
by publicly buying some liquor! I must refuse.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Shall we then lose our guest?

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: It might be for the best.
This clearly shows that for me he has no use.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: His brazen request might be only an excuse
to put your love to the test.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Now you know what to do.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Shall we then lose our guest?

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Do you mean raid the liquor store?!

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: We’ll break in through the window

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: If you want him to ask you to marry,
you must prove that you’re daring and smart
and know well how to practice his art.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: For his slightest wish I’ll give gladly my life.
I shall steal, I shall lie, I shall kill…
Wouldn’t I make him a wonderful wife?

body.stage: (In front of the Liquor Store, that same night)LAETITIALook to your left.
(The door opens)

sp.speaker: TOGETHER:
sp.l: How many ways of committing the same sin!

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: From this it’s plain that most

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: That’s just part of the orchestration.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: There are some bottles of gin.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: You hold the basket, while I put them in.

body.stage: (a bottle falls to the ground)

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Careful… You silly fool! What have you done?

body.stage: STOREKEEPER(from upstairs)Who’s there?!

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Hold on to your bottles and let us run!

body.stage: (Miss Todd’s Parlor, the next morning)

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Miss Pinkerton, won’t you sit down?

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: Have you heard? Have you read?
The whole town is in an uproar for last night
The owner, roused out of bed,
had a bottle smashed on his head!
for the thief is at large and well armed.
They believe it is the same thief
that has already caused such concern.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: We need measures more stern and protective!

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: They have hired a famous detective.
They will search every corner in town.
They will turn every house upside down.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: They won’t dare search my house!

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: They will search everyone and everywhere.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: A chambermaid came in my bedroom:
I need your sheet to spread out on the table
for it’s almost time for dinner. La la la la…

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: But your cousin sounds rather merry.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Or, the contrary, he’s raving with fever.

sp.speaker: MISS PINKERTON:
sp.l: Is he still so very, very ill?

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: I’m afraid that he never will be very, very well.

body.stage: (Miss Pinkerton leaves)

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Did you hear what Miss Pinkerton said?!

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: We’d better let him know, and run away.

body.stage: (Bob’s Bedroom, immediately afterwards)

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: I dare not trust my legs.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: My body is like a feather;
my head is full of lead…

sp.speaker: TOGETHER:
sp.l: We know who you are and whence you come.
We’ll help you all we can.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: We have no time to lose…

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: … to make you feel at home, did steal.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Aren’t you the man who robbed and killed
and raped and finally escaped from the county jail
of Timberville about a week ago?

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Who are you then, if not a thief?

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: I’m a beggar and a dreamer

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: And whence you come, if not from jail?

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: From the wandering of my trail.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: But still you have one thing to explain,
why did you take the money we left around for you?

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: But why should I have qualms?

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: There is no more doubt, ‘twas a fatal mistake.

sp.speaker: TOGETHER:
sp.l: and our honour are at stake!

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: To get you some money we robbed almost everyone…

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: I’ll stand by to defend you.

body.stage: MISS TODD(exalted and delirious)But now don’t you worry;I won’t let you down.I’ll stand by to defend you.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Of course, we must act in a hurry
and instantly flee from this town.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: We’ll run off together to France and lead
a new life of adventure and crime and romance.

body.stage: MISS TODD(almost out of if)We’ll run off together to France and leada new life of adventure and crime and romance.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: I your financial and moral support.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: But why should I run away?

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Is your love for me so small

body.stage: MISS TODD(outraged)So!Is your love for me so smallyou won’t stand by?

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: I don’t love you at all.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: After all that I have done for you,
you would see me in prison?

body.stage: MISS TODD(angry)Ungrateful wretch!After all that I have done for you,you would see me in prison?

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: to keep you out of it.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: I’ll make you feel sorry for this!
I shall accuse you of larceny, robbery and rape;
and who shall take heed of the tale you will tell?
But who will dare to suspect me of misdeed?
My blood is the bluest of town,
I’m respected as much as the mayor,
I direct all the social affairs
and I’m constantly in touch with the city.
I’m the chairman of ev’ry committee for hospitals,
So beware my dear boy, so beware!
For it would be a great pity
if I were to send you to prison
and see you condemned to the chair!

body.stage: MISS TODD(wrathful and vengeful)I’ll make you feel sorry for this!I shall call the police.I shall accuse you of larceny, robbery and rape;and who shall take heed of the tale you will tell?You come from nowhere.But who will dare to suspect me of misdeed?My blood is the bluest of town,I’m respected as much as the mayor,I direct all the social affairsand I’m constantly in touch with the city.I’m the chairman of ev’ry committee for hospitals,concerts and fairs.So beware my dear boy, so beware!For it would be a great pityif I were to send you to prisonand see you condemned to the chair!

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: I’ll tell them my tale; justice won’t fail.

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: Well, young man, you ask for your doom.
Laetitia, don’t let him out of this room!
I’ll go and get the police.

body.stage: (Bob’s Bedroom, immediately afterwards)BOBA nice mess you’ve got me in!

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: But I would like to help you,

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: Get away! I’ve nothing to fear.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: I can tell at a glance
you have not got a chance.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: That’s the wrong point of view.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: Miss Todd can wield such influence
no one shall dare take your defense.

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: has always been painted as stately,
can be tipped by her breath.
And it would be a great pity for one who’s
so young to be electrocuted or hung.
to be shut in a cell in Sing-Sing

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: What d’you care, as long as you’re free?

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: Shall my conscience fail to prevail?

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: You’re not built to wilt in jail.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: My two legs won’t take me far.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: Do you suggest that I run off with her?!

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: No! I suggest that you run off with me.
I know where she keeps the key.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: I don’t know of whom to be afraid…

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: I can see your decision is made!

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: The devil couldn’t do what a woman can:
make a thief of an honest man.

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: But as long as I’m taking the blame
I’ll live up to my fame
You look there for her linen and her fur coat

sp.speaker: LAETITIA:
sp.l: You look there for her money,

sp.speaker: BOB:
sp.l: Don’t forget to take the silver
that is on the mantel piece…

body.stage: (Miss Todd’s Parlor)

sp.speaker: MISS TODD:
sp.l: How odd! Her room is empty!
What!?! My safe has been looted!
They have ransacked and plundered my house!
They have even stolen my car! Help!
Thieves! They have stolen my silver!
